Long-term management should involve ongoing psychiatric follow-up, substance use counseling, and psychoeducation. Engage the patient with clear communication, involve family if possible, and coordinate care with psychiatric and substance use specialists to support recovery. This plan aims to rapidly stabilize symptoms, prevent complications, and facilitate sustained abstinence, ultimately improving the patient’s mental health and safety.
